intro: Ursinia nana subsp. nana, commonly known as the dwarf ursinia, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of around 10–30 centimeters and features dense, compact foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange, often blooming from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for gardeners seeking low-maintenance, drought-tolerant plants.
